metadata.feature_description: Bookmark and unbookmark articles for later reference

steps.expected: Wiki module displays with articles list
steps.actual: Wiki page loads but content only visible in Edit mode

steps.action: Enable Edit mode to view Wiki module
steps.expected: Wiki module with articles becomes visible
steps.actual: Wiki module visible in edit mode showing article list
Article creation dialog opened successfully with title, type, content fields

steps.action: Publish article and navigate to article detail view
steps.expected: Article detail page shows with bookmark button visible
steps.actual: Article created but detail page renders empty - no Wiki module content displayed

steps.action: Attempt to locate bookmark button on article page
steps.expected: Bookmark button should be visible in article detail view
steps.actual: Article detail page is blank - Wiki module not rendering on child pages. Bookmark button exists in code (Article.ascx lines 39-43) but UI not accessible

issues: Article detail view page does not render Wiki module content - the bookmark UI element exists in code but is not accessible because the article view doesn't load on child pages

steps.action: Prerequisite: Need to bookmark an article first
steps.expected: Have a bookmarked article to unbookmark
steps.actual: Cannot complete prerequisite - bookmark functionality UI not accessible due to article detail page not rendering

issues: Cannot test unbookmark feature as bookmark feature UI is not accessible - article detail view not rendering

steps.action: Look for bookmarked articles list in Wiki module
steps.expected: Find option to view user's bookmarked articles
steps.actual: No bookmarked articles list UI found in Wiki module. Code review shows bookmark data is stored but there is no dedicated UI for viewing bookmarked articles in the standard Wiki views

issues: No dedicated UI found for viewing bookmarked articles list. Bookmarks are stored but appear to be accessed through user profile or activity feed integration rather than directly in Wiki module

observations: Code confirms bookmark functionality exists in SocialController.cs with Bookmark() and Unbookmark() API methods (lines 46-77)
Bookmark/unbookmark buttons are defined in Article.ascx control (lines 39-43, 146-150) using dnnSocialBookmark CSS classes
Scoring action 'BookmarkedArticle' is defined in Mechanics.cs but awards 0 points by default
The test environment has a configuration issue where article detail pages do not render the Wiki module content - pages show only header/footer
Articles can be created and listed successfully in the Wiki module, but navigating to individual article URLs results in blank pages
The bookmark feature appears to be functional in code but the UI is not accessible in this test environment due to module rendering issues on child pages
